characters: ON MALEFICENT AND DIAVAL, THE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are flying above the moors of northern Scotland follow the rugged, rolling terrain at bird-height.

dialogues.speaker: WINGS
dialogues.text: Our shining BLACK WINGS rise and fall lazily as we ride t strong air currents. We drop down a steep stole and level out to skim the blue water of an expansive loch below. We wing our way above farmlands beyond. ee oe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pass above a FARM WOMAN below. She pours MILK from a j onto a large STONE.

dialogues.speaker: FARM WOMAN
dialogues.text: For the Fair Folk. We approach another farm house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two collies lay outside the house. They leap up as the SHEPHERD comes out with his YOUNG SON and WIFE. The Sheph and his boy walk toward the paddock. But they stop, disma to see that the paddock gate is wide open. The sheep are scattered across the wide field.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: The Pixies have been at it again! He WHISTLES. The dogs race across the field to round up t sheep. The boy runs to help. His wife goes back inside an returns with a heavy iron pan. She mutters an old adage a she positions the pan above the door. SHEPHERDвЂ™S WIFE "Iron pot above the door. Protect our home from dark ones of the moor."

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SHEPHERD AND SON
dialogues.text: They herd the sheep down the road. Ahead, it crosses a thin line of DARK GRASS which runs through the lighter grass of the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up! He takes off one of his work GLOVES and tosses it onto th road in the spot where it meets the line of dark grass.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Drop a glove before you cross a faerie path. They donвЂ™t like it if we donвЂ™t show respect. He whistles to the dogs. They nip at the sheep who trample the GLOVE as they run. boy picks it up and runs to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE TURN and follow the FAERIE PATH which leads into wilde MOORS with peat bogs, heath meadows, thin forests, stream and misty mountains in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE alight on the branch of a Blackthorn tree and TRAVEL d to reveal that WE are not a winged bird... ...but a WINGED GIRL. MALEFICENT is lean, all angles, with high cheekbones, a sharp chin and pointed ears. She looks about 15. She struggles with her LARGE WINGS like wild, unruly hair bef she gets them to fold behind her. ON THE MOORLANDS - MALEFICENTвЂ™S POV The natural sounds of the MOORS drift up to her. The soun gradually become discernible as VOICES: talking, laughing complaining, threatening, whining.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACKTHORN TREE
dialogues.text: She takes a few BLACK NUTS from the tree and CRUNCHES the shell and all. GUTTERAL GRUNTING sounds from below draw h gaze.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PEAT BOG
dialogues.text: MUD-COVERED CREATURES with round bodies and spindly arms legs move about in the bog. As they grunt and slobber, mu drips from their mouths which sustains and thickens the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several WINGLESS, WIZENED BALD ELVISH MEN burst from the branches, slapping her hands away from their nuts. * She makes an ugly face back at them. She grabs more nuts flies off following a ROCKY STREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent lands on the bank and sits on a rock to finish her stolen black nuts. Pretty, female WATER FAERIES admire their reflections. Th LONG GREEN HAIR is made of silky trailing weeds. Nearby, shy, timid MOSS PEOPLE with large eyes lurk in th dark wood foliage. As they run their hands over the dried dead moss, it turns GREEN once again. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONG GREEN ARM emerges from the water and reaches out toward MaleficentвЂ™s bare ankle. She looks down just as GREEN HAND grabs her ankle and jerks her off the rock. A MALEVOLENT WATER WOMAN, with knotted weeds and pebbles fo hair, pulls her toward the pond.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Let go! Maleficent kicks her away and flies off. The GREEN WOMAN slips back into the water. Maleficent fli toward a copse of tall trees ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lights in the branches of a tree to eat her black nut in peace. Loud, giggling LAUGHTER draws her attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three FLOWER PIXIES play hide-and-seek in the meadow. KNOTGRASS, THISTLEWIT and FLITTLE are small, lithe, fligh girls with pointed ears, noses and tiny transparent wings FLITTLE wears all blue. SheвЂ™s plagued with ever-present butterflies that fly around her head. THISTLEWIT has a tiny round head with tufts of wispy hair that splay outward around her face like a dandelion. KNOTGRASS wears green and brown.  10 11 Her short dark hair sticks upright or falls down into her eyes. Color flows from the Pixies fingertips making the petals brighter, the grass greener or sagging flowers revive. They hear BELLS in the sky and rise into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pixies fly past Maleficent in the tree.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: The King and Queen are coming! They flit away. Maleficent rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Gnats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is crowded with winged faeries. The beautiful QUE ULLA and her husband, KING KINLOCH lead the procession wh is lit by the wavering lights of WILL OвЂ™ THE WISP.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOORS
dialogues.text: Below, wingless FAERIES emerge: Small ELVISH MEN with fee of crows and tiny eyes. Creatures with the bodies of smal HORSES and the heads of HUMANS. Web-footed SPRITES with h sharp teeth and pointed ears. WILD ELVISH WOMEN lurking a the base of Trees. EXT. THE FAERIE FLIGHT - EVENING a1 Maleficent flies up to join the procession. She soars up a higher altitude above the Royals. Queen Ulla glares up at her. The PIXIES fly up beneath Maleficent.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Come down!

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re not allowed to fly above the Queen! This only makes Maleficent fly even higher.  12

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She soars high up, bursting through the clouds. Then she folds her wings and plummets straight down again through the crowded procession. Faeries flutter out of he way. She falls almost to the ground before her wings open and she soars up again. King Kinloch and Queen Ulla are not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: We have to do something about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The procession approaches a large grassy HILLOCK. The King and Queen land on the mound followed by the othe The Faeries are all the size of SMALL HUMANS with delicat pointed ears and tiny refined features. Ulla steps onto A LOW FLAT STONE which leads to her thron like a stepping stone. As she steps up on it, the STONE, emits a CONTENTED PURR. The King sits on his throne next to hers. A back-wind stirs the air briskly as Maleficent lands on mound among the faeries. She stands head and shoulders ab them. Her WINGS loom above her head. She seems like a lar untamed BAT among finches.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: Fold your wings. The Faeries fold their tiny wings. Maleficent has trouble getting hers to obey. The three Pixies smirk and giggle.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Maleficent!

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Yes, your majesty.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Step forward. Maleficent tries to take a step, but one wing is caught under the foot of another faerie. She tugs it out and ste forward. She hunches uncomfortably as all eyes turn on he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one flies above me.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Yes, your majesty. Knotgrass whispers to the other Pixies.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s those wings. She canвЂ™t control them. One of MaleficentвЂ™s wings lashes out and knocks Flittle down.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Maleficent! She grabs it and pulls it in closely.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Control your wings. Or you will be punished. Step back, Maleficent. Maleficent steps back. The others give her a wide berth.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: The King and I have just returned from a visit with the human King Henry. Like all humans, heвЂ™s easily impressed.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: All we had to do was show him a little magic, and he showered us with gifts. Serving faeries fly in with trays of human-made cakes, mi wine, etc. The faeries partake eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s the beginning of a beautiful friendship. Ulla frowns to see a WINGLESS BOY about MaleficentвЂ™s ag the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: What is he doing here? Kinloch is embarrassed to see him. STEFAN is the illegitimate son of King Kinloch and a human woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry, my love. (to the Boy) Leave the QueenвЂ™s circle, boy. The boy doesnвЂ™t move.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: Leave the circle!

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I have a right to be here.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: You have no rights at all, halfling. You have no magic. You have no wings...

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: But heвЂ™s the KingвЂ™s son. Ulla gasps. The faeries go silent. Kinloch chokes out the words.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: I...have no sons.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t have to pretend. ItвЂ™s no secret. Everyone knows that...

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Maleficent! UllaвЂ™s mortified at the public humiliation. She fixes Maleficent in a smoldering furious glare. The three Pixie draw away to be out of the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Ever since that tragic night that you were born, I have tried to find the good in you. I have tried for my sisterвЂ™s sake. She breaks down briefly. The King touches her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: But I have failed because there is no good in you. YouвЂ™re a devilish thing! You were born that way.  13 She abruptly waves her hand at Maleficent. SheвЂ™s STRUCK VIOLENT MAGIC which knocks her to her knees.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: You will wear these for a hundred years so all can see your true nature. The magic dissipates to reveal a pair of large black HORN embedded in the top of MaleficentвЂ™s head. The faeries d back in shock. Maleficent slowly reaches up to feel them. Horror crosses her face.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: No! She tries to pull them off. The faeries shock gives way t smiles and smirks. Maleficent pulls and strains. But the horns are firmly embedded. The Pixies laugh. Flittle laughs so hard, she sucks in one of her ever-pres butterflies and chokes. Maleficent locks eyes with Stefan briefly. He looks horrified and guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent walks through a shaded grove. Her head is bowed from the weight of the horns. She approaches a pond with WATER FAERIES. Frightened by the sight of her, they dive quickly into th water. She continues on. Two small HUMAN-HEADED HORSES ru off when they see her coming. She shrugs it off and continues on. Stefan appears out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Maleficent ? She abruptly turns and goes the other way. He runs around stand in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Go away.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t want to talk to you! One of her wings lashes out and knocks him to the ground. looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I just wanted to thank you for standing up for me.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: A lot of good it did me! She sits down on a rock. He gets up and sits next to her.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry about the... He indicates the horns.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Queen Ulla is a tyrant.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I know... They sit in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I like your wings.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I wish I had some.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t blame you. She holds a wing out for him to touch. He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: They donвЂ™t bite. He strokes the soft feathers.  14 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pixies gambol in the meadow. Bees and hummingbirds flit from flower to flower. Thistlewit spins around. Wisps of her hair fly off like dandelion seeds. Knotgrass runs through the meadow traili her hand in the low grass. The grass grows tall in her wa Flittle and Thistlewit study a blue flower.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: What color will you make the blue-bells this year? Flittle just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE MEADOW
dialogues.text: Maleficent walks with Stefan. Her wings drag on the ground. They flap with irritation which causes her to fly up. Stefan grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re drifting. He pulls her down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: TheyвЂ™re not happy when we walk. The Pixies see them approaching.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Maleficent. Those horns are perfect on you. Knotgrass steps on MaleficentвЂ™s trailing wing. She stumbles forward.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Go live with humans, halfling. Maleficent whirls around angrily. Her wings arch above her head.  15 16 11.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m a halfling too! Call me a halfling. Go ahead! They shrink back from her. She grabs Stefan.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Never mind them. They keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS, (0.S)
dialogues.text: You killed your mother. Maleficent stops, stricken by the words. She looks up. Th Pixies hover overhead. They drop rocks and mud down on th Maleficent uses her wings to protect Stefan.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Stay here. She opens her wings. The Pixies scream and fly away. Maleficent goes after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent chases the Pixies like a hawk after sparrows. They scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen Ulla and the King sit on the bank Water Faeries perform aquatic acrobatics for them. They e cake and drink milk from flower teacups. The three Pixies fly toward them, screaming, with Malefic right behind them. The Pixies hide behind the King and Queen. But Maleficent keeps coming in a fury.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Stop right there! Ulla throws MAGIC at her. MaleficentвЂ™s wings buckle and falls. She hits the ground hard.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: You see how devilish you are? I blame your father.  12.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: She deserves to wear the horns.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Yes, she does. (to Maleficent) Admit you deserve them.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Why should I?

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: IвЂ™1l1 clip your wings if you donвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You wouldnвЂ™t!

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Oh, but I would. Maleficent drops her head. She forces the words out bitterly.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I deserve to wear the horns.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: For a hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: For a hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Now get out of my sight! Maleficent opens her wings to fly.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Walk! She folds them and walks away, head bowed, wings trailing the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent and Stefan sit in a high branch together.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t kill my mother. She died the night I was born.  18 13.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I know. Everyone does. WhoвЂ™s your father?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: The Red Cap.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Him? No wonder youвЂ™re so... She gives him a sharp look.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: What? Wild, dark, strange, dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Tall. But she knows perfectly well thatвЂ™s not what he meant. sees something off, dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Oh no, the Rowan.

dialogues.speaker: ON A ROWAN TREE
dialogues.text: The trunk of the tree has been split by lightning.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She wonвЂ™t live. Hold onto me. She puts her arm around his waist and leaps from the tree StefanвЂ™s thrilled as they fly to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent stands in front of the wounded tree. She closes her eyes. Sweat drips down her forehead as MAG flows from her to the tree. Stefan watches, fascinated an envious. Gradually, the split trunk mends itself. But the process took something essential from Maleficent. She collapses against the tree trunk.

dialogues.speaker: THE HORNS
dialogues.text: One large horn, ringed and scarred, is rubbed vigorously against a tree trunk. It falls off. We hear a GASP of surprise. The other Horn is rubbed just vigorously. It falls off.

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s grown into a dark mysterious beauty. She rubs the places on her head where the horns had been. Stefan approaches. HeвЂ™s become a handsome YOUNG MAN.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: There you are! I have news.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Queen Ulla dead.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: How did you know? She nods at the horns on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Her spell is broken. She picks them up and throws them as far as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fair People stand silently on the banks of the loch watching four black swans carry the funeral bier across t water and into the setting sun. The Pixies stand on the b with the others. Flittle and Thistlewit whisper.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Who will be Queen now?

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: No one knows. She had no heirs.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: The Stone knows.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: What stone?  21 22 15.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: The QueenвЂ™s Stone. Anyone who wishes to be queen steps on the Stone. If she is false, it growls. If she is the one true Queen, it will it roar like a lion. Understand? Thistlewit studies her face.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: You have green in your eyebrows. I never noticed that before. Knotgrass looks skyward.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Why do I waste my breath?

dialogues.speaker: THE STONE
dialogues.text: A faerie foot lands on the QueenвЂ™s Stone. It growls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A female Faerie steps off quickly. Another female steps u The Stone GROWLS again. Kinloch shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent leans down to look at her reflection. She pull her hair back where the horns used to be. She turns, admiring herself without them.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: You were admiring yourself. She sees that heвЂ™s carrying a satchel.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Where are you going?  16.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: To the human castle.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve heard so much about it. I want to see for myself. A sudden feeling of dread overcomes her.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t go there, Stefan.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re not curious about humans?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You would be.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: (defensively) What is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re half human. ThereвЂ™s no shame in it.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m going then. She picks dead leaves from a tree branch as if she doesnв care.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Have a good time. He doesnвЂ™t go.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a long way if I have to walk...on foot.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: How else are you going to walk? On your ears?  23 24 25 17.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Maleficent, will you take me to the human castle?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Please? She sighs. She canвЂ™t say "no" to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent and Stefan fly entwined, arms tightly wrapped around each otherвЂ™s waists. StefanвЂ™s face is filled with the joy of flight, Malefic with the joy of being close to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fly through a thick layer of cloud cover. A stone wall suddenly looms in front of them. Maleficent veers up, but their feet hit the edge and they fall onto hard unfamiliar surface. PULL BACK to reveal... EXT. KING HENRYвЂ™S CASTLE - THE TURRET 25 TheyвЂ™ve fallen onto the high battlements of the King He castle. Maleficent looks around uneasily. Stefan runs his hands over the stones.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Look at the way the stones fit together perfectly. ItвЂ™s ingenious.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s unnatural. She touches the wall and shudders.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: The stone is dead.  26 27 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows Stefan down the steps, grabbing the iron rail as she goes. She gasps and pulls her hand away.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t touch the rail! ItвЂ™s iron! Stefan tentatively touches it.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I hardly feel anything, just a little sting. She looks at her palm. The flesh has been burned. He runs down the steps, touching the railing briefly as he goes. Maleficent tucks her hands in her robes. Her wings draw themselves up to avoid the iron railing as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter. The hall is crowded with humans and faeries. ThereвЂ™s food, drink, music and merry-making. Faeries perform aerial acrobatics. Others make rainbows and bring flowers to bloom for the children. The humans gasp and exclaim with delight. Maleficent is appalled by what she sees.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: What is this? Stefan wanders off, intrigued. Maleficent looks up at the high arched ceiling, feeling trapped. Ominous iron filigree hangs all around. She moves through the hall, becoming more dismayed. The Pixies have all gro up as well. But theyвЂ™re still immature and idiotic. Fli speaks to a group of humans.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m in charge of Blue. ItвЂ™s a big responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN YELLOW DRESS
dialogues.text: Can you turn my dress blue? Flittle squeezes her eyes shut and touches her yellow dre It turns blue.  19.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN YELLOW DRESS
dialogues.text: Hmm. I like it better yellow. Turn it back, please.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t make yellow. I only make blue.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN YELLOW DRESS
dialogues.text: Turn it back! Flustered, Flittle closes her eyes and reaches for the dress, but accidentally touches the womanвЂ™s hand. It promptly turns BLUE. The woman gasps.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Oh dear. ThatвЂ™s not what I...IвЂ™m terribly sorry... let me fix. She squeezes her eyes shut again and reaches out, brushin the womanвЂ™s face. It turns BLUE. The woman screams. Panicked, Flittle rushes away. Maleficent feels someone tugging at her wings. ItвЂ™s a HUMAN BOY. She jerks them The boy keeps touching her wings.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t touch the wings.

dialogues.speaker: HUMAN BOY
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re mean! What magic can you do?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: This. She waggles her fingers and walks away. The boy gasps. His fingers have grown together so he canв pull his hands apart. She walks up to Stefan whoвЂ™s chat with PRINCESS LEAH.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re leaving now.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s wrong? Look around! This is an embarrassment.  20.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t be silly. ItвЂ™s all in fun. Maleficent looks at her sharply.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m Princess Leah.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve been accused of being a lot of things, but "silly" is not one of them. IsnвЂ™t that right, Stefan?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: (nervously) Maybe we should talk over here. He tries to pull her away.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: This may come as a surprise to you, Princess, but we donвЂ™t exist to serve the human rabble.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Maleficent! He pulls her away.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: These people are our friends.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Friends? TheyвЂ™re using us! IвЂ™m leaving. Are you coming? She sees the somber look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Stefan?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m nothing there. My own father has disowned me. Her heart sinks as she realizes.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re not coming back.  21.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I could have a future here.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You never intended to.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Maleficent... She turns her back on him abruptly and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries down the hall, struggling against the tears. her distress, she canвЂ™t find her way out. She hears voi

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a shame we lost the little Queen. She was so easy to manipulate. The words cut through her distress. She turns back to listen. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR What did she die of?

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Old age. ItвЂ™s hard to believe she was over three hundred years old. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR What about the King?

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: He wonвЂ™t give us any trouble. She looks through the crack at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King is talking with his advisors.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Now that we have their trust, we can ask for anything we want. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR TheyвЂ™11 make us rich.  30

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Even better. We can use them against our enemies. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR TheyвЂ™re too unpredictable for that. ThereвЂ™s no way to control them.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: They have a weakness. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR WhatвЂ™s that?

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Iron. At the door, Maleficent reacts with alarm.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: I discovered it by accident. Then curiosity got the best of me and I tried it out on a few of them. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR I would have liked to have seen that.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Some were burned. Some died. I was impressed with their stamina. TheyвЂ™11 make good soldiers for us. 22. The door slams open. Maleficent storms in with murder in eye. Her wings knock the advisors down. She slams Henry against the wall, looming over him like a dark avenging angel. He cowers fearfully.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: If you touch another one of us, IвЂ™11 kill you! She releases him and storms out. The King falls to the floor, trembling and humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent returns to the hall. She looks for Stefan. still talking with Princess Leah. 30 HeвЂ™s  23.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Stefan!

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I thought youвЂ™d gone.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: We have to get our people out of here.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: The King is planning to use iron against us. He looks at her skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I said?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Why must you turn everyone you meet into an enemy? She backs away, shocked by his attitude. She sees guards come in. She hurries through the hall speaking quietly to the faeries.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Get out. Go back to the moors. YouвЂ™re not safe here. Some hurry away. Some stay. EveryoneвЂ™s confused. Henryв wife, QUEEN MARY stands with the Pixies.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s just Maleficent. Never mind her.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: She was born to cause trouble. The King runs into the Hall. He points at Maleficent.  31 32 24.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: That one! The guards run toward her. She looks at Stefan. Their eyes meet briefly. Then she op her wings and flies out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flies, wings beating furiously. Tears stream down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinloch yawns as more female faeries line up to try their luck with the Stone. It GROWLS every time. Maleficent lands on the mound.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Kinloch! Call our people back from the humanвЂ™s castle.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Their king is plotting against us.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s absurd. Henry is our friend.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Is he? He knows what iron can do. HeвЂ™s already used it against us.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t believe you.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I heard him myself!

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: But youвЂ™re a known liar.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I have no reason to lie!  33 34 35 25.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: Enough, Maleficent! YouвЂ™ve caused nothing but pain and heartbreak since the day you were born! He waves his hand in a circle. A STORM CLOUD appears above her head. Thunder cracks and sheвЂ™s pelted with hard, cold rain. She backs away with rain pouring down on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flies furiously out of the moors and over the human farmlands. But she canвЂ™t get away from the storm cloud. flies until sheвЂ™s exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent lands on a long branch where she sits, gasping and furious. The private rain storm still pelts her.

dialogues.speaker: ON A CROP FIELD
dialogues.text: A large RAVEN sits on the head of a SCARECROW. Two farmer throw rocks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY FARMER
dialogues.text: Get off! The raven leisurely preens its feathers as the rocks fly around it. Finally, a rock hits its target. The Raven squawks and flies to the tree.

dialogues.speaker: THE LARGE TREE
dialogues.text: The raven lands next to Maleficent. She glares at it. It glares back at her. They stew in silence. After a moment hops over on the branch so it wonвЂ™t get wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crumbling walls are all thatвЂ™s left of an ancient castl swathed in thick moor mist. Maleficent stands before the ruins. The rain cloud is gone.  26.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I need your help. She hears guttural breathing and the scratching of claws. Something large approaches. The mist stirs. Maleficent waits. In a moment, a MAN walks out of the mist. He holds heavy staff. HeвЂ™s even taller than Maleficent and fierc handsome with dark malevolent eyes. He wears a worn RED C that color of blood. Maleficent looks very much like him. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER Take the throne yourself.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You know why IвЂ™ve come. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER IвЂ™m always watching. YouвЂ™1l have to kill Kinloch.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t do that. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER Where does this conscience of yours come from? It doesnвЂ™t serve you. Your mother was burdened by it too. His dark eyes soften briefly to think of her. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER If you want to save your friends... although I donвЂ™t know why you would after all theyвЂ™ve done to you...

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m the only one who knows what this human Henry is planning. I canвЂ™t stand by and let him use us like servants and slaves! MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER Then act! Do what must be done. But you will be hated for it.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s nothing new. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER Then unleash yourself. Make me proud. He steps back. The mist swallows him up.  36 37 38 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent stands at the edge of the muddy bog. She close her eyes. Sweat drips down her forehead as MAGIC flows fr her to the bog. It begins to bubble and boil. Something large moves around in the mud. One by one, five CREATURES crawl from the bog. Her GUARDS are large, dour ugly with leathern wings, long arms that drag the ground feet turned backwards. As the last one crawls out, Maleficent sags from exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent flies low to the ground followed by her guards She searches for something on the ground. She sees what sheвЂ™s looking for, scoops them up, and flies on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Faeries are still lined up to stand on the Stone. Oth entertain themselves with human objects: combs, brushes, mirrors, etc. Maleficent lands on the mound.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I want my turn on the Stone. She walks toward it with determination. The Faeries scram to get out of her way.

dialogues.speaker: FAERIE KING KINLOCH
dialogues.text: Stop right there! STOP! She steps up onto the QueenвЂ™s Stone. It SCREAMS in prot so loud the faeries cringe and hold their ears.

dialogues.speaker: FAERIE KING KINLOCH
dialogues.text: Step off! Step off! But Maleficent holds her ground. Her guards land on the Mound. The Stone still screams. Sh motions to Kinloch. They pull him off the throne and drag him away. Maleficent steps off the QueenвЂ™s Stone. Its stops screaming abruptly.  39 40 28. Maleficent plants herself firmly on the throne. Her guard take their places beside her. She takes out the horns she retrieved from the ground. She replaces them on her head sits back confidently. Queen Maleficent.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: No one leaves the moors for the human world. Not now. Not ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Pixies fly toward the Moors carrying gifts from the humans. As they approach the FAERIE PATH, it LIGHTS O FIRE. FLAMES SHOOT skyward in front of the Pixies. They d back. After a moment the FLAMES dissipate.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Sudden inexplicable flames from nowhere. They fly forward and SMACK into an INVISIBLE WALL. They f into the grass, dropping their loot. Thistlewit gets up a tries to fly forward again. She hits the invisible barrie and falls again. She tries yet again, and falls.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a binding spell.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: We cannot pass. Thistlewit keeps flying at the barrier like an angry bee. They drag her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Henry and Queen Mary look out over the banquet hall.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Where are all my Fair folk?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: TheyвЂ™ve gone save for those three. The Pixies sit at the table eating milk and cake.  29.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: You three. Approach. The Pixies come forward. He waits for them to bow. Queen Mary whispers helpfully.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: Bow to your King. They look at each other...should we? Knotgrass shrugs. Th bow. Flittle feels someone staring at her. She looks up t see the WOMAN with the BLUE FACE glaring at her. Flittle steps behind Thistlewit to hide.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Can you spin straw into gold?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Can you conjure up a storm?

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: What can you do?

dialogues.speaker: BLUE -BELL
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re flower pixies.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: We brighten your day with cheery blossums and blooms. They flit around, bringing all the wilted flowers and bouquets back to life. The King and Queen consult.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: We need better ones.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: (to the Pixies) Where are all your friends?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Someone put out a binding spell along the Path. None of us can pass through.  30.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Who would do such a thing?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: It must be that tall bad-tempered one with the evil name...Malafisis.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Do you know her? They shake their heads vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s no friend of ours. Knotgrass spots Stefan strolling with the princess. She points.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: But he knows her very well.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: You there... young man! Stefan looks over and indicates...me?

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Approach. Stefan looks at the Princess. She smiles encouragingly. Stefan approaches King Henry. He bows.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: What is your name, son?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Stefan.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: I havenвЂ™t seen you before. Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: The moors.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: No one lives there but the Fair Folk. They look Stefan over: no pointed ears, no wings.  31.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re not...

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: No, sir. IвЂ™m as human as you are. Thistlewit makes a choking sound. Stefan glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: You must be a changeling then.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Changeling?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: He was taken from his cradle as an infant and raised by the Fair Folk. Stefan doesnвЂ™t deny it.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Then you can be of use. Do you know of the evil fairie named Mafil... Macif...

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Maleficent.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: You do know her.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Henry throws his arm over StefanвЂ™s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re a good looking fellow. I can see my daughter has taken quite a liking to you. StefanвЂ™s eyes fill with possibility. King Henry steers away. The Pixies watch all this curiously.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t know Stefan was a changeling. I thought he was a halfling.  41 32.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: He is a halfling. But Queen Mary thinks heвЂ™s a changeling.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Maybe heвЂ™s half a changeling.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s not half a changeling. HeвЂ™s a whole halfling. Thistlewit blinks.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m confused.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Of course you are. They move off. Flittle almost runs into the Blue Lady who glares angrily. She hurries off with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent walks near a stream followed by her GUARDS. Th sounds of the BABBLING STREAM becomes BABBLING VOICES.

dialogues.speaker: STREAM FAERY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The Stone screamed.

dialogues.speaker: STREAM FAERY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She has no right to the throne.

dialogues.speaker: STREAM FAERY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She was wrong to make herself Queen. She hears them but keeps walking. Her guards growl and ru toward the stream faeries.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Leave them alone. The guards turn back reluctantly. They keep following her breathing down her neck.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: And stop following me! They stop. she continues on alone.  42 43 44 45 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent sits on a rock eating black nuts, feeling more alone than ever. A LONG GREEN ARM emerges from the pond a reaches for her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Touch me and you will draw back a shriveled stump. The Green WomanвЂ™s arm retreats back to the pond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The once-green Faerie Path is now a long black line of demarcation between the wild moors and King HenryвЂ™s hum domain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stefan sits in a wagon next to a DRIVER. King HenryвЂ™s c is visible in the distance behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHEPHERD, his WIFE and SON stand at the place where t Faerie path crosses the road. The sheep stand in a huddle, oddly silent. The Farmer whistles for the collies who lay in the farm house yard.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Did you hear me boys? Come up. The dogs whine but donвЂ™t budge. Stefan and the driver approach in the wagon. The horse whinnies and rears. STEFANвЂ™S DRIVER Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: THE SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Your horse wonвЂ™t cross it. The Shepherd points to the burned and blackened path. Stefan looks up. The birds fly straight up and down there like fish in a tank.  46 34.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: The Fair Folks have put a curse on us. THE SHEPHERDвЂ™S WIFE I canвЂ™t think why. I put out milk and cake for them every day.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: (to the driver) IвЂ™1l walk from here. Stefan gets off with a knapsack. The driver turns the wag around. Stefan steps up to the Faerie path and studies it

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: (to the shepherd) Can you cross it? He and his family step back, fearfully.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: We donвЂ™t dare.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOY
dialogues.text: At night, we see a horned bird with a head of a woman flying in the sky. SHEPHERDвЂ™S WIFE She has a host of goblins behind her. Stefan tries to step across. It takes an effort for him t push through the invisible barrier. Then something gives and he stumbles onto the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stefan looks around, astounded by the sudden difference i the colors and lushness of the countryside surrounding hi The shepherd and his family wave to him from the other si

dialogues.speaker: THE SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Good luck to you!

dialogues.speaker: THE BOY
dialogues.text: Watch out for the evil Bird Woman! He starts off, following the black line of the Faerie Pat into the wild moors beyond.  47 48 49 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent sits on the throne, surrounded by her ugly slavering guards. They scratch and snarl like mangy dogs. Maleficent has her chin in her hand, feeling very alone. hears something and sits up abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Quiet! She listens. A VOICE on the wind is calling her name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stefan stands on a high hill above the moorlands which sw away below him.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Maleficent! He squints as he sees something in the distant sky. What appears to be a horned bird with very large wings soars toward him. He watches as Maleficent flies closer. His fa is a mixture of joy and regret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent lands on the hill. Their faces fill with emoti to see each other again.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I knew you didnвЂ™t belong in the human world.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Oh, I belong there, more than I do here.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Then why did you come back?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I missed you too much. Her heart leaps.  36.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You missed me?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I love you, Maleficent... I always have... He takes her chin in his hand and kisses her. Her eyes close and she falls back in a swoon...off the hilltop. He looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her guards look up to see their leader doing giddy air lo in the distance. They frown and grunt with disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent and Stefan sit under the shelter of her wings, talking softly.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I have to admit there are some things that humans do better than we do.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t imagine what.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Food for one thing. He opens his backpack and takes food out.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Bread, cheese, honey cider... He pours a bit of cider into his cup. He offers her some. She pushes it away.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Nothing human for me.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t know what youвЂ™re missing.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m perfectly happy with what we have.  37. She tips a large red Blood Rose that blooms on a twisting vine. Red dew drops into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I wonder what it would taste like if we mixed the two together? He tips the Blood Rose into his cup.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: The best of both worlds. He swirls it around and takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Not bad. He takes another teeny sip. Maleficent considers. Giving she holds out her hand for the cup, but he holds it back.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Nothing human for you. They tussle over the cup. She grabs it out of his hand an takes a big gulp. He waits for the verdict. She takes another drink, considers.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s dreadful. He laughs. She smiles at him. Love shines through her who being.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Promise me you will never leave again.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Never. They lay back against the tree together.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I want this moment to last forever.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: We have forever. She closes her eyes, drifting off. But she opens them, suddenly panicked.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I was afraid youвЂ™d gone.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Still here. She sighs with contentment and closes her eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent has fallen into a deep unnatural slumber. Stef sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Maleficent. He shakes her shoulder roughly.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Maleficent! She doesnвЂ™t stir. He takes a long thin IRON CHAIN from pack. He holds it over her. His hands tremble. His face i wracked with emotion. He shakes his head and drops his hands. After a moment, he lifts the chain again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent groans from pain. She sits up and shakes her h to clear the thick sleep. The pain on her back is intense She looks around for Stefan, then reaches over her should Her fingers touch a long cauterized burn where her wings used to be. On the shock and horror in her eyes we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stefan runs down the road carrying a large bundle on his back. The DRIVER sits in the wagon nearby. He jumps off t help him load the bundle.

dialogues.speaker: AAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHH
dialogues.text: 55 56 57 58 39. Her ANGUISHED OUTRAGED WAIL echoes down the hills and acr the Moorlands. Stefan looks up. At the sound, the BURLAP BUNDLE shifts and struggles.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I shouldnвЂ™t have done it.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s too late now. They lash the bundle down and quickly drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent thrashes around, trying to reach the painful wounds. She plunges into the river. The WATER FAERIES retreat, watching with huge fearful eyes. Maleficent clim out and runs, delirious from the agonizing pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs to escape the pain. At the top of a high hill, she leaps into the air forgetting in her delirium, that she no longer has wings. She falls, crashing down the hill to the bottom where she lies, gasping and bloodied. As she lays there, she looks up at the birds flying overhead. Her pain and heartbreak are unspeakable. EXT. KING HENRYвЂ™S CASTLE - DAY 57 The drawbridge opens for StefanвЂ™s wagon. INT. KING HENRYвЂ™S CASTLE - DAY 58 Stefan stands with King Henry. The bundle lays at his fee no longer moving.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I couldnвЂ™t kill her. So I took these instead. He draws back the burlap. The large black wings are tied with heavy ropes. Fascinat King Henry leans down for a closer look. The Wings strugg startling him. He leaps back.  59 40.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Her wings have always had a mind of their own.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Will she want revenge for this?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Absolutely. But sheвЂ™s hobbled now. The Fair People wonвЂ™t follow a wingless leader.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Brilliant, son. YouвЂ™ve served me well.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: And the other thing? Henry sighs. He has no choice.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: IвЂ™11 tell the Queen to prepare for a wedding. Stefan nods. Whatever guilt he felt has been swept aside by ambition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent still lies in the place she fell. Something ha left her forever: hope, belief, the capacity for love. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER Get up, Maleficent. She opens her eyes. Her father stands over her, holding his staff. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER This pain is a gift. You can use it to grow stronger than you ever were. She closes her eyes again. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER Or you can lay here and die. He drops his staff at her side and walks away.  60 61 62 41. A long moment passes before her fingers feel for the staf She uses it to pull herself to her feet. A WOLF howls. Leaning on the staff, she sees a LARGE SILVER WOLF on a distant hill. It turns and disappears into the mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the staff as a crutch, Maleficent limps across the blackened Faerie Path. Her eyes are filled with hatred. She limps past the farme house and paddock. As she passes, the gate opens. The she run out. She walks through the middle of human crop field The crops wither on the vine in her wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weather changes. Clouds move across the sky. Malefice still walks. But sheвЂ™s stronger now. She stands more upright, leaning less on the staff. Dry stone walls collapse where her staff hits the ground. She walks with a stronger stride. The staff is no longer crutch. She plants it on the ground near a barn and farmhouse. The ground shakes violently. The structures collapse. Farmers, families and animals run out. She stands near a town. She lifts the staff. Storm clouds suddenly move in. A high wind blows. Lightning hits the church steeple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent stands on a hill, overlooking her path of destruction. Nothing built of human hands remains standin She seems stronger than ever. Her gaze is intense and fierce, all weakness gone. She smiles for the first time since Stefan took her wings. Bu thereвЂ™s a hard glint in her eye that wasnвЂ™t there bef

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 63 64 42. INT. MALEFICENTвЂ™S RETREAT - DUSK 63 Maleficent sleeps in a dark place in the woods near crop fields. She opens her eyes at the sound of birds. She looks up to watch the birds ride the wind in the sky above. SheвЂ™s lost in bittersweet memories briefly.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Awk ! EXT. A FARMERвЂ™S FIELD - HER POV 64 The raven from years earlier, sits on a stalk studying a pile of ripe corn on the ground. It flies down and snatch an ear. A heavy net falls over him.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY FARMER
dialogues.text: Got him! The raven struggles to escape.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Awk! Awk! The two farmers approach with heavy clubs. From her retreat, Maleficent watches the humans hatefully The farmers advance on the bird, raising their clubs...

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now a man. The raven transforms into a MAN. DIAVAL finds himself on ground in a naked human body. The Farmers are stunned. Diaval throws off the net and climbs to his feet unsteadi

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY FARMER
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a devil! Diaval grabs the club and swings at them.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: I am the devil! I come from hell for you! The frightened farmers run. Diaval drops the club and loo at his human body with dismay. As a MAN, Diaval is black-Irish with silky black hair and dark eyes. His voice has a rich, melodic Irish lilt.  43. He also has a touch of vanity and heвЂ™s prone to preenin Maleficent steps out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: What have you done to my beautiful self?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Would you rather I let them beat you to death? He lifts his wingless arms and looks down at his naked bo

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not certain.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Stop complaining. I saved your life.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Forgive me. I am in your debt. She tosses him a cape to cover himself. He looks her over

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: What happened to your wings?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You remember me.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: They were magnificent.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™11 be my wings now. 65 INT. HENRYвЂ™S CASTLE - THE HALL - DAY 65 King Henry rants and raves at Stefan.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: You said they would return!

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I never said...

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: You said they wouldnвЂ™t follow a wingless leader!  66 67 68 44.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: The binding spell is still in place.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t want excuses! I should be rich and control of all the land! Instead, my kingdom is in ruins! He wave toward the open window. Stefan glances out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crops are dead. The human structures are destroyed as a tornado has come through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pixies stand on the tower battlements looking out. Butterflies swarm around FlittleвЂ™s head.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Do you think Maleficent did this?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Who else could it be?

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Why would she do it?

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s evil for evilвЂ™s sake.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: She doesnвЂ™t need a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go down the winding stairs to a small landing. They through one door, then down another set of stairs. They t in a circle, confused.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Where are we?  69 45.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: No, this way. She opens the door. She gasps at what she sees inside. Sh stumbles back into the other two. They lose their footing and all fall, screaming, down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: I should have known not to trust someone who was raised by elves!

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Fair People.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: If you donвЂ™t do something about that evil witch...

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s not a witch.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: I gave you my daughterвЂ™s hand. I made you next in line to my throne. If you donвЂ™t do something, IвЂ™11 annul the marriage and throw you in the dungeon! The Pixies tumble into the room and land in a pile on the floor. FlittleвЂ™s butterflies scatter in the air.

dialogues.speaker: KING HENRY
dialogues.text: Get those useless imbeciles out of my...! One of the butterflies flies into his mouth. He sucks it in, gags and chokes. The Faeries giggle. Henry staggers, trying to breathe. Hi crown falls onto the floor. StefanвЂ™s eyes fill with a d realization. He waves the Pixies away. Knotgrass and Flittle grab Thistlewit and run out. HenryвЂ™s face is turning purple. Stefan leans down. Henr thinks heвЂ™s going to help him. But Stefan merely picks the fallen crown and walks out.  70 46.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Diaval the Raven has seen the whole thing. He flies away. EXT. STEFANвЂ™S FOREST - LATER 70 Maleficent paces in a clearing. Diaval, the Man, has finished telling her what he witnessed.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: And now heвЂ™1l be king. He did this to me so he could be king! She screams with frustration and rage. WHITE FIRE erupts from her. A nearby tree bursts into flames. The flames sweep from one tree to the next. SheвЂ™s so lo her fury, she doesnвЂ™t realize sheвЂ™s set the trees on

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Mistress! You donвЂ™t know what youвЂ™re doing! This is not what you want! Mistress! His words get through. Her anger fades and now she sees t trees burning.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: No... She closes her eyes. With a supreme effort, she draws the flames back into herself. She closes her ROBES, snuffing them out, then falls to he knees, exhausted. Smoke rises from her. She looks up, aghast to see the ruined trees. She closes eyes again. New magic flows from her to the trees. New bark grows, new green leaves sprout. Soon, they are a beautiful as they were. She stands up, renewed, as if a d catharsis has occurred.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Come, Diaval. IвЂ™ve been gone too long. He lands on her shoulder.  71 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinloch and a group of faeries attempt to retake the thro while MaleficentвЂ™s guards are sleeping. But they wake up, slavering and snarling. Kinloch throws MAGIC at them, but it has no effect. The guards advance on them. The largest guard throws Kinl to the ground and steps on him, laughing. The others grab faeries and toss them into the air like r dolls or attempt to pull their wings off like cruel children. The faeries scream.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stop! The Guards drop the faeries and look around nervously. Maleficent stands in the shadows with Diaval on her shoulder. She sets the Horns on her head, then gathers he courage and steps boldly into view.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: Maleficent. She sets her jaw and walks through the astonished faeries toward the throne.

dialogues.speaker: A FAERIE
dialogues.text: Where are her wings?

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER FAERIE
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s lost her wings. She faces the largest guard who stands between her and th throne. She waves him out of her way.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Move. He spits at her. Brackish ooze rolls down her cheek. The Fearies pull back nervously. She moves to grab him, b he flies up into the air. The other Guards fly up and cir her from above.

dialogues.speaker: AWK
dialogues.text: He starts to fly up to defend her.  72 48.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Diaval. She waves him away. She looks up at her own minions circl above. They drop down, claws extended, screaming like banshees. She fights them with white fire and sheer power will. Finally, all the five guards lay on the ground at her feet... subdued but alive. Gasping and bloodied from the fight, she walks past them steps onto the QueenвЂ™s Stone on her way to the throne. Stone SCREAMS, startling her. She stumbles off, then turn back to it, angrily.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve had enough of that. She holds her staff out over the Stone and slowly raises The Stone is uprooted from the ground. It hangs in the air. She makes a motion with her Staff. The Stone is flung away. It lands with a heavy THUD somewhere in the far distance. She sits down on the thron Diaval lands on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Anyone else want to challenge me? No one says a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent bathes in the cold water. Diaval lands on a tr branch nearby. Maleficent washes her back and finds one o the long raised scars. Her fingers linger there. Maleficent covers herself with her cape as she emerges fr the water. She waves her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now a man. Diaval transforms into a MAN hidden by bushes. She tosses him a small bag of clothes she carries for him.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Tell me. Diaval emerges, fully clothed. HeвЂ™s nervous about deliv the news.  49.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: King Stefan and Queen Leah have had a child. The news she had been dreading.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Oh blessed day. Have they named the little beast?

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Aurora.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: The dawn. How clever.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: TheyвЂ™re having a christening soon.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: And you didnвЂ™t bring my invitation? 73 EXT. KING STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - DAY 73 People dressed in formal attire approach the castle. Festive flags fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People fill the hall. Stefan and Leah greet the well wishers. Knotgrass, Flittle and Thistlewit enter.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Not those three!

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: Be gracious, Stefan. They have magical gifts for our child.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t want any butter-flies around the baby! The Pixies stand over the babyвЂ™s bassinet. Old Queen Mary attends her. Knotgrass reaches in and touc the babyвЂ™s forehead.  50.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Sweet Aurora, I give you the gift of beauty. Flittle reaches in to touch the baby.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Dear child, you will... She notices the Blue Lady in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: ...never be blue but happy all the days of your life. ItвЂ™s Thistlewit turn. A doors bang open. WIND whistles through. THUNDER CRACKS and Maleficent is there. Diaval flies in and perches on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Maleficent! HeвЂ™s suddenly very afraid.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: So Stefan, youвЂ™re king at last. ItвЂ™s what you always wanted. You would have done anything...well, you did.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re not welcome here.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: And IвЂ™m deeply offended by that. (to Leah) Ah...the lovely Leah. But where is the child? You must be so proud.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Stay away from her

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Oh Stefan...do you really think I would harm an innocent babe? I only want to view the little creature. The Pixies stands in front of the bassinet protectively. Maleficent laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You three! Well, thereвЂ™s fierce protection! Out of my way, gnats!  51. She blows at them. A FIERCE WIND blows them back. Part of ThistlewitвЂ™s hair is blown off. She grabs her h aghast. Maleficent pulls aside the drapery and leans over the bassinet. BABY AURORA is as adorable as babies get. As she looks at the baby, jealousy fills her heart. The old anger and revenge rise up in her again. She looks at Stefan as if i is only the two of them in the room.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You stole something precious from me. And now, you owe me something precious in return.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Take what I am owed.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Guards! They start to run toward her, but Maleficent holds her st up. They freeze, mid-step.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Calm down. IвЂ™m not going to steal your baby. I merely want to give her a gift. She looks down at the baby again.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: The child will, indeed, be blessed with beauty and happiness all the days of her brief human life.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: Did you say...brief?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Enjoy your little girl while you can, Princess. YouвЂ™1l have her until her sixteenth birthday. They can be such monsters at that age, youвЂ™11 probably thank me for this. Leah is so frightened sheвЂ™s almost in tears.  52.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Guards! They still canвЂ™t move.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Listen. At midnight on her sixteenth birthday, something will happen, a small thing really, a simple mishap. She glances into the corner and sees Queen MaryвЂ™s SPINN WHEEL.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™1l prick her pretty little finger on the spindle of a spinning wheel... She looks around at the frightened faces, holding their breaths. Maleficent takes her time, enjoying this.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: . And die ! Faces fill with horror. Leah screams. She looks at Stefan

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Fair is fair.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Please, donвЂ™t do this. IвЂ™m sorry for what I did to you. Maleficent laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Not sorry enough. She lifts her robes. White fire erupts around her.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Wait! Listen to me! She disappears in the smoke. Diaval circles the hall. He flies out the open door. Commotion erupts. Leah runs to t bassinet and scoops up the child.  53.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: Stefan! Do something! Flustered, he points to Thistlewit.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: You! You havenвЂ™t given your gift yet.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: Can she undo the curse?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: No. MaleficentвЂ™s much too powerful now.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: But you could alter it somehow.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Alter it?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Change it, you idiot! Change MaleficentвЂ™s curse!

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: But IвЂ™m only a flower pixie!

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™1l help you. Knotgrass and Flittle take her hands. Leah holds the baby out toward her. FlittleвЂ™s butterflies flit around her.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t think with all these butterflies! Flittle draws her butterflies away. Knotgrass whispers in her ear. Thistlewit repeats it.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Aurora will prick her finger on her sixteenth birthday. But it will not be...uh...uh... Knotgrass whispers again. She continues.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: ...death that claims her, only sleep. Stefan nods. Now Flittle whispers into ThistlewitвЂ™s ear  75 76 54.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: And she can only be woken by true loveвЂ™s kiss. Thistlewit touches the babyвЂ™s forehead.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: My child is saved!

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Maleficent wonвЂ™t be stopped that easily. Burn all the spinning wheels!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent sits on her throne, telling the guards all abo it. Diaval watches from nearby. She The his EXT.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: He was begging me. You should have seen their faces. "Not our baby!" sighs with deep satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Revenge is everything they say it is. Guards grunt and slaver in agreement. But Diaval twists bothered. KING STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - THE NURSERY - NIGHT 76 The Pixies and Queen Mary watch over the bassinet. Queen Mary snores.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t think Stefan like us very much.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: We did treat him badly when he was young.  77 55.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: It was his fault for being a halfling.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™d like to get rid of us, but we know too much. Flittle sighs, playing with her butterflies.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: I wish we could go home to our fields and flowers.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Maleficent will never let us come back now.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: So weвЂ™re trapped here with mean Stefan. Stefan enters.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Mean King Stefan. And youвЂ™re right, I cannot stand the three of you. So I have a task that will keep you out of my sight for a very long time. EXT. KING STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - NIGHT 77 The Pixies sit in a wagon in rough peasant clothes. Leah holds the baby, distraught. Diaval watches from a nearby tree.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t do this!

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Do you want our child to be safe? He pulls the baby out of her arms and hands her to the Pixies.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Take the baby deep into the forest. Hide her there. On the day after her sixteenth birthday, bring her back to us. Do you understand?  78 56. They nod.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Say it. What will you do?

dialogues.speaker: PIXIES
dialogues.text: Hide the baby in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Until when?

dialogues.speaker: PIXIES
dialogues.text: Until her sixteenth birthday.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re not stupid! He whips the horse.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Stay away from the moors! Leah weeps bitterly.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Stop crying. You can have another child. He motions for Queen Mary to take her. Then he speaks to Captain.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Arm the men with iron weapons. Hunt Maleficent down. When you find her show no mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diaval sits in a tree at the side of the road. The Pixies wagon stops beneath. A baby cries in the back.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Don your kerchiefs, ladies. We must wear them at all times so we will not be recognized. They put them on. The wagon continues on.  79 80 81 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An abandoned cottage sits a clearing. Diaval lands on the roof. The PixiesвЂ™ wagon approaches.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: What we need is an abandoned cottage where no one will find us. He squawks to draw their attention.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Awk !

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Like that one? She points to the cottage.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Exactly. We need a cottage just like that. Be on the look-out. They keep driving past it, right out of the clearing. Dia twists his head as if he canвЂ™t believe what idiots they After a moment, the wagon appears again. The Pixies study the cottage, then scream and run to it. They brush away cobwebs, open the door and go inside. Flowers burst from the windows. Climbing roses speed up t rough walls. Diaval flies off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent sits on her throne as Diaval, the Man, fills h in.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s trusting those idiots? To raise his baby? ThatвЂ™s priceless! I have to see this for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cottage teems with flowers, inside and out. Maleficen and Diaval peek into the window at the baby in a basket. Maleficent looks at her with undisguised dislike.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s so ugly, I could almost feel sorry for it.  82 58. Diaval looks in at the baby.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BABY
dialogues.text: It gurgles. Nothing could be cuter. They hear the Pixies back away.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: The Pixies stand around the basket looking at the baby wh started to cry.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t stand the crying. SheвЂ™s giving me a headache.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Quiet, baby!

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: All she thinks about is herself.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Maybe sheвЂ™s be hungry.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Do you think she likes fruit?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: All babies like fruit. They put a whole uncut apple, a banana and an orange in t basket with the baby.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: That should shut her up for awhile. They walk away.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: That babyвЂ™s going to starve with those three looking after it. Maleficent walks away, unconcerned. Diaval twists his hea worried for the child. He flies away briefly, then return with a large WHITE FLOWER.  83 84 85 86 87 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hops in the window and onto the edge of the basket. He holds the MILK FLOWER to the babyвЂ™s mouth. She sucks it happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby wails inside the cottage. Diaval paces on a long branch in a tree anxiously. Finally, he flies over and lo in the window. ON THE PIXIES - DIAVALвЂ™S POV The Pixies sleep right through the babyвЂ™s wails. They h cotton stuffed in their ears. Diaval hops inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby cries in its cradle. Diaval hops onto the edge. He uses his weight to make it rock gently. Gradually, the baby stops crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Diaval flies through the forest, he hears human sounds horsesвЂ™ hooves, shouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diaval flies toward Maleficent urgently. She waves her ha to transform him.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now a man. He transforms into a MAN. She tosses him his clothes. He changes behind the bushes.  60.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: StefanвЂ™s men are on the hunt for you. HeвЂ™s armed them with iron weapons.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I have weapons of a different sort. She lifts her staff. A thick MIST rises up in the forest. ON STEFANвЂ™S MEN TheyвЂ™re enveloped in impenetrable MIST. ThereвЂ™s mass confusion.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Retreat!

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She moves away through the forest. Without warning, StefanвЂ™s MEN come out of the mist dire ahead. Their horses charge toward her. She doesnвЂ™t have time to run. Suddenly, an ENORMOUS SIL WOLF leaps out in front of her. The horses panic and rear. The WOLF chases them away. Maleficent sits down on a rock and waits. In a moment, her father approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I could have handled that myself. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER I shouldnвЂ™t have interfered.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s not like you. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER I donвЂ™t know what came over me. But IвЂ™m glad to see that youвЂ™ve come back with a vengeance. The curse was masterful.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Stefan deserves everything he gets.  88 89 90 61. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER An eye for an eye. Tooth for a tooth.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Exactly. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER IвЂ™m proud of you. ItвЂ™s just the sort of thing I would have done. He walks away into the mist. Maleficent thinks about that oddly unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KING STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE 88 The Captain takes off his heavy helmet. HeвЂ™s dusty and exhausted. Stefan holds up a hand.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t speak unless the words are: "Maleficent is dead". The Captain drops his head and trudges out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A childвЂ™s screams and laughter fills the air. The Pixie chase THREE YEAR-OLD Aurora across a meadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent and Diaval watch from a high tree across a ste gully beyond them.

dialogues.speaker: THE MEADOW
dialogues.text: Knotgrass stumbles and falls. ThereвЂ™s a Pixie pileup.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Get off!

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve lost my slipper!  62.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
