dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re stepping on my hair. As they pinch and squeal, toddler Aurora runs on. ON THE BABY - MALEFICENTвЂ™S POV The unsupervised toddler runs straight toward the steep drop-off of the gully.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: The little beastie is going to fall into that ravine.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PIXIES
dialogues.text: The Pixies havenвЂ™t even noticed that Aurora is gone.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Do they even know sheвЂ™s gone?

dialogues.speaker: AWK
dialogues.text: He flies off to alert them.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TODDLER
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s coming closer to the drop-off.

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s getting nervous.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Go back. YouвЂ™re going to fall.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TODDLER
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s still not slowing. She runs right to the edge of drop-off.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Go back!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TODDLER
dialogues.text: She runs right off the steep edge. But she doesnвЂ™t fall hangs in midair, her chubby legs still running in place.  91 92 63.

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She holds out the staff, magically keeping the baby in th air.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BABY
dialogues.text: The baby laughs gleefully.

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She smiles despite herself. She spins the staff.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TODDLER
dialogues.text: The baby spins upside down and back around, then keeps running in midair back to the cliff. Her little feet land firm ground and she runs back the way she came.

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She drops the staff and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diaval flies around the PixiesвЂ™ heads trying to get the attention. They swat at him.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Go away! Diaval snatches at ThistlewitвЂ™s hair.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t touch the hair! Diaval hears laughter. He sees the toddler coming back toward the Pixies. She runs to them. They pick her up.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: There you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent sits on her throne. Diaval is perched on her shoulder. He preens his feathers. She draws absently in t dirt with her staff. TheyвЂ™re both thinking of Aurora.  93 94 95 64.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I wonder what the little beastie is up to? They both leap up a little too eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pixies are having a picnic. AURORA is 5 years old now Maleficent and Diaval observe from the forest shadows. An autumn downpour suddenly drenches the Pixies. They scream and run into the house forgetting all about Aurora. Aurora follows them back to the cottage. But theyвЂ™ve already closed the door. She pounds on it, no one answers. She cries. Still no one comes. Maleficent and Diaval look at each other. Aurora goes aro the cottage, looking for a way in, sobbing and getting drenched. Maleficent throws up her hands with disgust. She lifts her STAFF. A GALE FORCE WIND angrily blows the front door off its hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pixies stare at the broken-down door. Aurora walks in drenched and crying.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora is 7. She gathers berries. She sits down under a t to eat a few. In a moment, her eyes close and she drifts off. A SNAKE crawls towards her from the bushes. It gets closer. Suddenly a tall HORNED SHADOW looms over the sleeping gir MaleficentвЂ™s staff lifts the SNAKE and tosses it away.

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She stands over the sleeping child.  96 97 98 99 65. Her expression softens briefly. Then she shakes her head if admonishing herself for having a weak moment. She glan up at Diaval in the tree.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: What? He turns his head away as if he saw nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora is now 10 years old. She plays sword fight with an invisible friend near a rushing river.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Yah! Yah! Have at you! Her game takes her to the river. She crosses on the stepp stones, but loses her balance and falls into the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The current is strong. SheвЂ™s swept downstream. She goes under, comes up, gasping, grabs for tree roots, anything. She goes under again. Her hand reaches up and finds... MaleficentвЂ™s STAFF. She grabs onto it with both hands a sheвЂ™s pulled onto the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lays face-down on the bank, not moving. MaleficentвЂ™ HORNED SHADOW leans over her to see if sheвЂ™s breathing. Aurora gasps. MaleficentвЂ™s shadow retreats.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ON AURORA AND MALEFICENTвЂ™S SHADOW - DAY 99 15 year old, AURORA runs toward the faerie path and the moors beyond. MaleficentвЂ™s shadow with Diaval on her shoulder tracks her as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come back, Aurora!  66. Aurora turns around. MaleficentвЂ™s shadow quickly blends with the shadow of a rock. Aurora is very pretty with tin delicate features. The Pixies beckon her from the cottage

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t go near the moors!

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Why canвЂ™t I?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Because we said so.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: You always say that.

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT AND DIAVAL, THE MAN
dialogues.text: They sit on the rock, watching her go inside.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: TheyвЂ™re going about this all wrong. If they tell her "no", thatвЂ™s exactly what sheвЂ™1l do.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: May I ask you a question?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: That depends.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: When are you planning to undo your curse?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Who said I was planning to undo it?

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Mistress.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I hate the little beastie.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: You hate Stefan! May I speak freely?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You canвЂ™t seem to help yourself.  100 67.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re not as bad as you think you are. Annoyed, she waves her hand to transform him.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Be a bird! But this time, he catches her hand and holds it.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Every time you donвЂ™t like what I have to say you transform me back into a bird.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I thought you liked being a bird. He looks at her with more feelings than he can share.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Not as much as I used to. Maleficent looks away. She waves her hand abruptly and transforms him. INT. STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - THE GREAT HALL - DAY 100 King Stefan has aged beyond his years. Children run and scream. Leah is with child again.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Your children are driving me mad!

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: TheyвЂ™re your children too. The Captain approaches. He bows and removes his helmet. H gone grey.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Well? The Captain shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t want to hear that!

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: He didnвЂ™t say anything. Let the man speak.  STEFANвЂ™S CAPTAIN Sire. My men and I have searched the length and breadth of the land, kingdom to kingdom, shore to shore and back again. We have endured rainstorms, blizzards, gale force winds, scorching heat and the attack of countless wild creatures. But Maleficent is not to be found. I am sorry I have failed you.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re dismissed! The Captain trudges off, secretly relieved.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: Why are you still looking for that witch?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s not a witch.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: She may be dead.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s not dead. I would know if she were. Leah looks at her husband curiously.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: Is there something you havenвЂ™t told me?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: You have to forget about Maleficent.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: Aurora will be returned to_us soon and this unpleasantness will be behind us.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: What is your mother doing? Old Queen Mary sits by the window at a spinning wheel. 68.  101 69.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: Spinning, Stefan. She enjoys the work.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I had all the spinning wheels destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s been years. IвЂ™m certain Maleficent has forgotten all about that silly insult at the christening.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: She has not forgotten. Maleficent cannot be underestimated. We have to remain diligent, especially now. I want that spinning wheel burned. Leah looks at her husband, thinking of all the other men might have married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent sits on her throne surrounded by the guards. Diaval sits on her shoulder. Kinloch and some faeries approach.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: Your Majesty. SheвЂ™s instantly defensive.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: What is it? DonвЂ™t you like the way I govern? AllвЂ™s well in the moors, is it not?

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Then what seems to be the problem?

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re not free to go to the human world.  102 103 70.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Ah well, thatвЂ™s a price we all must learn to live with. Now go away before I become unpleasant.

dialogues.speaker: KINLOCH
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Become? Maleficent heard that. She levels her dark gaze on him.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: This is not unpleasant. Do you want to see what unpleasant looks like? MaleficentвЂ™s face changes. Her darkest nature comes to the surface. Anger and bitterness twist her face so that she does look truly frightening. White Fire erupts all around her. Kinloch an faeries rush away. Maleficent strokes Diaval.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: He made me do that. I didnвЂ™t enjoy it at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent stands outside the cottage.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: She can see Aurora in her nightgown getting ready for bed

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She looks torn as if battling dark forces within. She tur abruptly and walks away. INT. AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM 103 She lies in her bed. The Pixies open the door.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Is she asleep yet? She closes her eyes, pretending. They close the door.  104 105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pixies take off their tattered, peasant sweaters like too-tight brassieres and release their wings, stretching them out. INT. AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM 105 She opens her eyes again and sits up. She looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOORS
dialogues.text: The mist rises up across the hills in the distance. The moors seem to beckon her.

dialogues.speaker: ON AURORA
dialogues.text: Aurora looks back at the kitchen, then opens the window a slips out into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora runs across the faerie path and into the moors, leaping with mischievous joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora follows the faerie path. She hear the FAERIE VOICE She stops to listen.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOORLAND FAERIES
dialogues.text: She sees the Fair Folk camouflaged in the flowers, trees, streams and ponds.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: I knew you were here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent has returned. She approaches the cottage soundlessly. She sees AuroraвЂ™s window, open now. She fr and looks inside. ON AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM - HER POV The bed is empty. AuroraвЂ™s nowhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worried, Maleficent moves around to the kitchen window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pixies fly around the kitchen, bashing into each othe knocking things over and laughing hysterically. Milk jugs lay spilt on the table. Butterflies abound.

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She looks around for Aurora in a panic. Diaval flies towa her. She waves her hand to transform him.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now a man! He transforms before he lands. He hits the ground hard.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Can you wait until IвЂ™ve landed?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Have you seen Aurora?

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: I spotted her in the moors.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Then what are you doing here? You shouldnвЂ™t have left her alone! She canвЂ™t wander around out there by herself!

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: I thought you hated her. She hurries away. He looks down at his human body.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t leave me like this.

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She waves an impatient hand over her head.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Be a bird. In a moment, Diaval strafes her head, just a little too close.  110 73.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Stay with her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The full moon shines down on Aurora who stands at the bot of the tree looking up at the Elves. They screech at her. SheвЂ™s not afraid of them. Diaval circles overhead and l in a nearby tree to keep watch.

dialogues.speaker: A PEAT BOG
dialogues.text: Aurora approaches the peat bog and watches the Wallerbogs drool and dribble. ON MALEFICENTвЂ™S MOON-SHADOW - AURORAвЂ™S POV MaleficentвЂ™s shadow looms over her suddenly. ItвЂ™s dis and clear in the moonlight. Aurora smiles to see it.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: I know youвЂ™re there. The shadow retreats suddenly. She turns around.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t be afraid. MaleficentвЂ™s amused voice answers from behind the rocks

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not afraid.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Then come out.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™1l1 be startled.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: I wonвЂ™t. Come out. Maleficent emerges. Aurora smiles, not the least surprise by her appearance.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Hello, Faerie Godmother. Maleficent tries not to laugh.  She turns again. 74.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You think IвЂ™m youвЂ™re Faerie Godmother?

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Who else would you be? YouвЂ™ve been watching over me my whole life.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Somebody had to.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve always known about you...ever since I was a little girl. around so that MaleficentвЂ™s shadow falls over her

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: You see? ThatвЂ™s the shadow IвЂ™ve been seeing ever since I was small. Wherever I went that shadow was always with me. But donвЂ™t you have a bird? In the shadow, Diaval lands on MaleficentвЂ™s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: This is Diaval. Aurora turns and reaches up to pet him. He preens. WILD ELVISH WOMEN and WEB-FOOTED SPRITES with sharp teeth watc from the thick tangled roots of trees. Aurora sees them.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Who are they? Maleficent steps between them.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Not everyone you meet in the moors is benevolent. You must never come out here alone.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not afraid.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s enough for one night.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: But... Maleficent waves her hand in front of her eyes.  75.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Sleep. Aurora goes limp. Maleficent catches her by lifting her hands. Aurora floats in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A prone, sleeping Aurora drifts back toward the cottage. Diaval flies ahead. Maleficent walks behind. 112 INT. THE COTTAGE - AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM 112 Maleficent lowers her back into her bed. She pulls the covers up, then she waves her hands over he

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: My curse is undone. You are free to live a long and happy life. And you will never tell your aunts about me. Good night, beastie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen is a disaster. Flittle climbs up on a stack o chairs to get a vase. Thistlewit and Knotgrass sit at the table. Thistlewit has her head in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: I drank too much milk. Why did you let me do that?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: WhereвЂ™s your kerchief?

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: I lost it. Knotgrass tries to put a kerchief on Thistlewit who pushe her away. Flittle reaches for the vase. She loses her balance and falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Ah! That wouldnвЂ™t have happened if I could use my wings.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Shh! SheвЂ™11 be up soon.  76.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: I want to fly again!

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: I want to go back to the castle!

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: So do I! Do you think I like being trapped in this horrid little cottage with you two imbeciles? They all start to cry. Aurora walks in to find her aunts bawling. She shakes her head as if this is nothing new.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: There. There. What happened this time?

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: I fell and hurt myself. She helps Flittle up.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Poor old thing. Wait. I have a question. How old are you? YouвЂ™ve looked the same my whole life. And another thing, why do we have spring flowers even in winter? She waves at the butterflies.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: And where are all these butterflies coming from? No one ventures an answer.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: So, did you sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: And why do you always ignore my questions! They putter around the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Would you like breakfast, Cabbage?

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: She doesnвЂ™t want cabbage for breakfast. Who eats cabbage for breakfast?  77.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t say, do you want cabbage for breakfast? I said...do you want breakfast, Cabbage? Aurora shakes her head and looks skyward... Why me ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora plays in the peat bog with the Wallerbogs. Mud flies. She laughs hysterically. Maleficent and Diaval share their amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora and Maleficent sit together on a rock overlooking moors. They watch Diaval soar high on the wind above.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: And heвЂ™s also a man?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: If I want him to be. Aurora watches Heather Faeries fly over the meadows below

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Do all of the Fair People have wings?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Most do.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Then why donвЂ™t you? The old anger suddenly rises up in Maleficent.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I said...most do! AuroraвЂ™s taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Sorry I asked. Maleficent softens.  116 78.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I had wings once.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: What happened to them?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: They were stolen from me. ThatвЂ™s all IвЂ™1l say about it.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: What color were they?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Black. And thatвЂ™s enough about them. Aurora waits a minute.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: How big were they?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Aurora. Aurora goes quiet. Maleficent looks off, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: So big they dragged behind me when I walked. And they were strong. They could carry me above the clouds and straight into the headwinds. They never faltered. Not once. I could trust them. Aurora can see her loss and regret. She takes her hand. Maleficent looks down at StefanвЂ™s childвЂ™s hand in her Her heart freezes. She pulls it away.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Time to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk back together across the misty hills. Diaval fl above.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: I have a confession to make. + eH O*  79.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: All day long, all I can think about is coming back to the moors. I love it here. It feels like home to me.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: This is not your home. Aurora walks a little ahead of her.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Then where is it? And donвЂ™t tell me itвЂ™s that cottage with my aunts. She steps onto the edge of a WHITE STONE that juts up fro the ground. As her foot lands briefly on it... it ROARS, shaking the ground. Aurora jumps off quickly.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: What was that? Maleficent looks around, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Come back. Quickly! Aurora hurries back toward her and steps on the stone aga It ROARS. Aurora runs to her side. Maleficent and Diaval look at the white stone. ON THE QUEENвЂ™S STONE ItвЂ™s tilted and half-buried in sod and grass.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: So thatвЂ™s where it fell. Aurora approaches.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: What is it? Maleficent looks from the QueenвЂ™s Stone to Aurora...and again with shock and realization.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s wrong?  117 80.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Nothing. Go to sleep. She waves her hand in front of her eyes. Aurora goes limp. Maleficent keeps her aloft as she sleep She looks at Diaval.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: How is it possible? She closes her eyes and holds her staff out over the Ston She slowly raises it out of the ground and sets it uprigh on top of the ground. She brushes the dirt away. Then she slowly lowers the prone, sleeping Aurora onto th QueenвЂ™s Stone. SheвЂ™s so small she fits on it perfectl As her body settles down, the STONE PURRS, exactly the wa it did when Ulla stood on it years earlier. Maleficent lo at Diaval with disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent stands before the ruins. In a moment, her fath appears. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER This is an interesting twist of fate.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: If Aurora is the true Queen, then maybe I should step down. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER YouвЂ™d give up your throne? To the child of your sworn enemy no less? WhatвЂ™s gotten into you?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: It was never mine. I took it by force. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER You did what had to be done at the time. Forget about the Stone. Bury it. No one will ever know.  118 81.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I will know. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER ThereвЂ™s that conscience again. I think the raven is right about you. He seems disappointed as he walks back into the ruins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent walks, practicing what sheвЂ™s going to say.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s something you need to know....this is going to come as a big shock...no...sit down... She hears AuroraвЂ™s laughter. She listens. ThereвЂ™s ano unfamiliar voice. A YOUNG MANвЂ™S voice. The words are no distinct. Maleficent peers through the foliage.

dialogues.speaker: ON AURORA AND PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Aurora is talking to a handsome young man who holds a whi horse.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: I'd better be on my way. He gets on the horse.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s your name?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Phillip. Maybe IвЂ™11 be lucky enough to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Then I would be lucky too.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Where do you live? She opens her arms.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Here.  82.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Then IвЂ™1l1 see you here! He rides off. Aurora watches him go with a secret smile. MaleficentвЂ™s MOON-SHADOW looms over her suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: And who was that?

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: No one.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: (angrily) I saw you talking to a man... Who was it ? AuroraвЂ™s surprised by her anger.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Oh, his name was Phillip... HeвЂ™d lost his way.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: You are not to talk to strangers.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: You sound just like my aunts.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I am not like your aunts!

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Then why are you acting like them?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m trying to keep you safe!

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m almost sixteen! I can take care of myself! She turns and runs off. Maleficent doesnвЂ™t go after her

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Fine! Go on! Get yourself out of your own mess. IвЂ™ve had enough if it! She steams for a moment, then looks over at Diaval ina nearby tree.  119 120 121 83.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Well, go after her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora sits down on a rock to sulk. A LONG GREEN ARM emer from the water and reaches toward her. Diaval arrives jus as the GREEN WATER WOMAN grabs AuroraвЂ™s ankle. The Gree Woman pulls Aurora toward the water. Diaval dives at her.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Awk! Awk!

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She hears his cry. She listens.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No! Let me go! Maleficent runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora kicks at the Green Woman as she pulls her toward t water.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Let go!

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: She runs. Her robes fly behind like wings.

dialogues.speaker: THE POND
dialogues.text: The Green Woman has Aurora in the water. Diaval dives at her. Aurora SCREAMS as the cold water closes over her hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Green Woman drags her down into the dark depths. Diav dives down into the water after them. He stabs at the Green Woman with his beak. Aurora struggl to get out of her grasp. Suddenly, Maleficent plunges into the water. She pulls Aurora out of the Green WomanвЂ™s grip.  122 123 84. Aurora swims to the surface as Maleficent, the Green Woma and Diaval battle underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coughing and gasping, Aurora drags herself out of the pon She runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battle continues until the Green Woman floats away lifelessly. Maleficent kicks to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: She explodes out of the water, gasping for air. She climbs onto the bank and sees the ravenвЂ™s body floa in the water. She picks him up and lays him on the bank. doesnвЂ™t move.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Diaval? She waves his hands over him frantically.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now a man! Diaval transforms. But heвЂ™s still not breathing.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Diaval? Diaval! She pounds on his chest. He gasps suddenly, and gulps for air. Maleficent leans back, more relieved than she ever thought sheвЂ™d be. Diaval sits up.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I thought IвЂ™d lost you. But this is too revealing.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Then what would I do for wings? Diaval covers his disappointment at her cavalier attitude He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: WhereвЂ™s Aurora? INT. THE COTTAGE - AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM 124 Aurora sleeps in her bed. Maleficent stands over her.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Aurora? She doesnвЂ™t stir. Maleficent pulls the covers over her gently and goes out. Diaval sits in the window for a moment before he flies aw After theyвЂ™ve gone, Aurora opens her eyes. INT. THE COTTAGE - AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM - DAY 125 The Pixies burst into her bedroom, waking her abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Cabbage!

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re going on a lovely journey today. Aurora looks out the window at the moors.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t want to go on a journey.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t have a choice. Get her dressed. They throw clothes at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pixies are in the wagon. Aurora is reluctant. She loo out at the moors.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not going.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s someone I need to talk to.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Who? You donвЂ™t know anyone.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not going. Knotgrass finally loses it.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Sixteen years. WeвЂ™ve looked after you out here in the middle of nowhere in that broken down raggedy hovel for sixteen years!

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™ve put up with your whining and crying and puking...

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: And all your stupid questions that we donвЂ™t know the answers to!

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™ve done our job. And now weвЂ™re giving you back. Get in the wagon! They pull her into the wagon forcefully and jam her in between them. Knotgrass whips the horse. Aurora looks bac at the moors as they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. KING STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - EVENING 127 The Pixies wagon approaches the castle at a dead run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hall is being set up for AuroraвЂ™s arrival the next Servants set up tables. Children run through. Leah holds a baby. The Pixies enter with Aurora. SheвЂ™s utterly bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: PIXIES
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re back!  87.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? You are not to arrive until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Today is her sixteenth birthday.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I told you to bring her the day after her birthday. Aurora looks around at the heavy oppressive room...the ir filigree above. She puts her hand on the stone wall and pulls it back quickly. She shudders.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Well, itвЂ™s been a long time. How can we be expected to remember?

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I should have known not to trust Flower Pixies! WhereвЂ™s the child? He looks right past Aurora. They push her toward him.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: This?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Aurora, meet your mother and father. Aurora is so shocked she canвЂ™t speak. Leah hands her ba a nursemaid and opens her arms to Aurora.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: Come over here and let me have a look at you. She backs up a step.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: What are we going to do with her? The idiot Pixies have brought her back a day too soon. Flittle folds her arms.  129 88.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Well, weвЂ™re not taking her back.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t stay anyway. She rubs the tip of her index finger absently.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™1l have to lock you in a safe place for the night.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: I know itвЂ™s a terrible homecoming, dear. But your fatherвЂ™s worried about some old curse.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: I have to go back to the moors.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: That life is over. Stefan pulls her away. Flittle sees the lady with the Blu Face who has grown much older. She points at Flittle.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE LADY
dialogues.text: You ruined my life! Flittle grabs Knotgrass urgently.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve changed my mind. I want to go back to the horrid little cottage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stefan ushers Aurora firmly down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Let me go back. Please. This is a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: The whining and begging may have softened the Pixies, but not me. He puts her in a room.  130 131 132 133 89.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Welcome home. WeвЂ™1l talk in the morning when this is all over. He closes the door and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutters bang on the windows. Diaval lands on the sill an looks in.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Awk! Awk! Maleficent emerges from the shadows and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks though the messy abandoned cottage. The flowers are wilted without the Pixies presence there. One stray butterfly has been left behind. She goes into AuroraвЂ™s bedroom. INT. AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM - NIGHT 132 But the bed is empty. Alarm floods her face.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Diaval! He flies in the window.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Those idiots have taken her! Fly to StefanвЂ™s castle! I have no wings! Fly! INT. STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - THE KITCHEN - NIGHT 133 The Pixies gorge themselves on milk and pastries while th servants bustle around them. Diaval lands in the window.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Even if we did bring her back too soon, weвЂ™ve still foiled MaleficentвЂ™s curse.  90.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: She wonвЂ™t die when she pricks her finger. Thanks to our quick thinking.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: My quick thinking. I was the one who said: "It will not be death that claims her only sleep." Diaval twists his head curiously.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: I gave that idea to you.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: No, you didnвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: And I thought up the part about "true loveвЂ™s kiss".

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: No, you didnвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Yes, she did.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: It was my spell! I said "She can only be woken by true loveвЂ™s kiss"!

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: We gave it all to you.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: No, you didnвЂ™t! Diaval has heard enough. He flies away. 134 INT. AURORAвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT 134 The moon shines on Aurora who rubs the tip of her index finger again. She goes to the window and looks out. Diava lands on the sill.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Diaval? Is that you?  135 136 137 91.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Awk! He flies off.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Where are you going? She rubs her finger again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stefan paces nervously as he talks to his men. The small to AuroraвЂ™s room sits on a table.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Maleficent will come at midnight to watch her curse unfold. The moment she appears, use the iron. Do not hesitate. Diaval lands on the table. Stefan sees him. He realizes and makes a grab for him. Diaval evades him a snatches the key in his beak.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Catch that bird! Diaval flies around with the key in his beak evading the men. He flies out of the room. Diaval flies down the hall with StefanвЂ™s men behind. He startles the oncoming serv and knocks over tables and chairs. INT. AURORAвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT 136 She hears a commotion in the hall. A key rattles in the door. EXT. THE HALL - ON AURORAвЂ™S DOOR 137 Diaval flutters as he tries to fit the key in the lock wi his beak. StefanвЂ™s men run toward him. He finally manages to fit it in. The men throw objects. H evades them, then turns the key with his beak.  138 139 140 141 92. INT. AURORAвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT 138 She hears the lock turn and turns the knob. The door opens. Outside, the guards and servants scream and throw things the raven who flaps around to distract them. Aurora slips away unseen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent runs as fast as her feet will take her. She lo skyward, wishing desperately for wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stefan looks in the open door to AuroraвЂ™s empty room.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Search the castle for the princess Aurora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diaval flies toward Maleficent. He swoops down. She waves her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now a man. He hits the ground running transformed into a MAN. Maleficent tosses him a bag of clothes.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: The Pixies changed your curse.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: My curse was undone years ago.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: They replaced it with their own.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: The Pixies? TheyвЂ™re not smart enough.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Listen! When she pricks her finger tonight, Aurora will fall asleep.  142 143 93.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Fall asleep? Now thereвЂ™s a nasty curse.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: And she can only be woken by "true loveвЂ™s kiss". Her laughter fades abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Say that again.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: She can only be woken by "true loveвЂ™s kiss".

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: But thereвЂ™s no such thing.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s no such thing as "true love." It doesnвЂ™t exist. SheвЂ™s looking right at him. But she canвЂ™t see the lov his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: If she pricks her finger, sheвЂ™1l never wake up. SheвЂ™1l sleep forever. We have to stop her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora races up the tower stairs and runs into a small ro to hide. The Bell Tower clock starts to CLANG midnight. O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters the tiny room. The clock CLANGS again. TWO. Qu Mary sits under the moonlight, working at a spinning whee

dialogues.speaker: HUMAN QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: Hello Aurora. YouвЂ™ve grown up to be a lovely young lady.  144 145 94. The clock CLANGS. THREE. Aurora rubs the tip of her finge which is throbbing terribly.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: HUMAN QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: Your grandmother, dear. The clock CLANGS. FOUR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent watches Diaval fly ahead. She runs until she canвЂ™t run anymore. She doubles over to catch her breath ON STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - HER POV She can see it in the far distance.

dialogues.speaker: ON MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: But she knows sheвЂ™1l never make it in time. She lifts h fists in fury.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I need wings! She hears a WHINNY.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE WHITE HORSE
dialogues.text: A MAGNIFICENT WHITE HORSE runs down the hill toward her. stops at her side, nostrils flaring. She nods and leaps astride its bare back. They gallop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora canвЂ™t take her eyes off of the SPINDLE.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Why are you spinning up here all alone? She draws closer. Her finger throbs. The clock clangs FIV

dialogues.speaker: HUMAN QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: King Stefan wanted all the spinning wheels burned. SIX.  146 147 95.

dialogues.speaker: HUMAN QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: Your mother and I hid this one up here where he would never find it. SEVEN. Mesmerized, Aurora reaches out toward the spindle.

dialogues.speaker: HUMAN QUEEN MARY
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t touch! ItвЂ™s sharp. You could prick your finger... EIGHT. She pulls her finger back and rubs it.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: But I... NINE. She reaches her finger out again.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: ...must. TEN. Stefan runs into the room.

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: ELEVEN. Aurora pricks her finger on the spindle. The CLOC strikes TWELVE. Aurora falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent gasps as she feels Aurora fall. The horse stop as if it felt it too. She crumbles over the horseвЂ™s nec Despair fills her heart.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - AURORAвЂ™S ROOM - LATER 147 Aurora lies on her bed, deep in enchanted sleep. Stefan and Leah look down at her. The Pixies are there as well. Leah weeps.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Stop crying. SheвЂ™s only sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: What do we do now?  148 149 96.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: WasnвЂ™t there something about a kiss to wake her? They all turn to look at Thistlewit.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Why are you looking at me?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re the one who changed the spell.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Me! But you said...

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: (to the Pixies) Find someone to kiss her. Someone suitable. He goes out. Leah soothes her baby.

dialogues.speaker: LEAH
dialogues.text: Not any kiss will do. It has to be "true loveвЂ™s kiss". Well thatвЂ™s what you said. She goes out. The Pixies look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. OUTSIDE STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - NIGHT 148 Maleficent watches the WHITE HORSE gallop away to the top a hill. With a heavy heart, she heads toward the castle. something stops her. She looks back at the hill. Her FATHER stands where the horse stood a moment before. lifts his hand to her.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM - LATER 149 The Pixies have found a YOUNG MAN. He stands over the bed looking at Aurora.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: But sheвЂ™s sleeping.  97.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: She wonвЂ™t mind. He shrugs and kisses her. The Pixies wait expectantly. Sh doesnвЂ™t wake up.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: You didnвЂ™t do it right.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s supposed to be true loveвЂ™s kiss.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: True love? I donвЂ™t know even her.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 150 EXT. STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - NIGHT 150 Maleficent has arrived at the castle. She slips across th drawbridge in the shadows. 151 INT. AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM - NIGHT 151 The Pixies have found another young MAN.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: This is Princess Aurora.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: IsnвЂ™t she beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Yes, she is. HeвЂ™s clearly very attracted to her.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Are you in love with her?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Absolutely!

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: You can kiss her then. He kisses her eagerly. Aurora doesnвЂ™t wake up.  98.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: If it was true love, you would have woken her up!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Let me try again. He leans down. They push him away.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 152 INT. STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - NIGHT 152 Maleficent slips unseen through the halls. She looks into each room as she passes them. Diaval flies toward her. She transforms him.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now a man. He transforms, very sad.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™ve lost her.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 153 INT. AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM - NIGHT 153 The three Pixies usher in another YOUNG MAN. ItвЂ™s Phill

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: This is Princess Aurora. He looks at the sleeping girl.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: I know her.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s helpful.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Why is she sleeping?  99.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s trapped in an enchantment.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: IsnвЂ™t she beautiful? HeвЂ™s smitten.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: The most beautiful girl IвЂ™ve ever seen. The Pixies share excited glances. This is going well.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Do you want to kiss her?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Very much.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Then go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: I wouldnвЂ™t feel right. I barely know her. We only met once.

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: HavenвЂ™t you ever heard of love at first sight?

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: Kiss her. He leans down toward her. He leans up again.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: An enchantment, you say?

dialogues.speaker: PIXIES
dialogues.text: Kiss her ! Now ! They push him forward.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t push! He leans down. The Pixies hold their breaths. The prince kisses the princess. Their lips touch gently... perfectly And nothing happens. The Pixies faces fall. Aurora sleeps on. Phillip looks at the Pixies.  154 155 100.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Is something supposed to happen now?

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT
dialogues.text: They push him out. They trudge out to find another candidate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pixies walk down the hall, dejected.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: I was certain he was the one.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s wrong with all these young men?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: We have to keep looking. Dig deeper. Scrape the bottom of the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: FLITTLE
dialogues.text: He doesnвЂ™t have to be a prince. He doesnвЂ™t even have to be handsome.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: All he has to be is a man. INT. AURORAвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT 155 The moon shines down on Aurora. Maleficent enters. Diaval the Man, comes in behind her. Maleficent looks down at he heartbroken. She sinks down on the side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: This is my fault. I did this to you...for revenge. I didnвЂ™t know how much I would love you. But I promise to look after you...every day for the rest of my life. Sleep well. She kisses her gently on the forehead. And something magical occurs. Aurora opens her eyes. Maleficent gasps. Aurora smiles.  156 157 101.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Hello, Godmother. Maleficent is so astounded she canвЂ™t speak for a moment finally finds her voice.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Hello, beastie. She pulls her into her arms. Joyful tears fall. Diaval is overwhelmed as well.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: No truer love. He joins them.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Can we go home to the moors now?

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Right now. ThereвЂ™s voices in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Wait. He opens the door cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s eerily quiet. No servants. No sounds.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now a bird. Diaval transforms and flies ahead to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flies into the great hall. Maleficent and Aurora follo There are no servants. No one about. The door on the opposite side of the room stands open. Escape. MaleficentвЂ™s eyes narrow suspiciously. They slink along the wall toward the open door. Diaval fl up to the rafters. He lands on the iron filigree where a heavy IRON NET has been hung.  158 102.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Awk! Maleficent looks up. Stefan appears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Drop it! The iron net falls from the ceiling. Maleficent pushes Aurora out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Get out of the castle! She falls to her knees dropping her staff. The net burns exposed flesh. Aurora tries to pull the heavy iron net off of her.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Get out of here! Go back to the moors! Aurora backs away reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Go now! Aurora runs. Stefan nods for some of his men to go after her. Other men run out with iron weapons and poke at Maleficent like a trapped animal. The Pixies watch with horrified fascination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora runs up the stairs trying to get away from Stefanв men. She reaches a landing, runs through a door and finds herself in another stairwell. She keeps climbing.

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT HALL
dialogues.text: Maleficent tries to get up, but sheвЂ™s weakened by the i She reaches for her staff. Stefan kicks it out of the way He walks around her.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I should have killed you that night. It would have saved us alla lot of trouble.  159 160 103. She glares at him with silent hatred. He nods to his men. StefanвЂ™s men draw their weapons. Diaval drops down from of the rafters at them.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Kill that bird! Some fight him off. Others stab at Maleficent. She grabs their weapons throug the net even though it burns her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora flings open the door at the top of the stairs and runs inside. She peeks out to see if anyoneвЂ™s following feels something behind her. She turns. Her eyes go wide. ON MALEFICENTвЂ™S WINGS Her wings are bound in chains held upright in a glass coffin. Aurora approaches them, awed by their size and beauty. She looks through the glass. They flutter suddenly. Still alive. She steps back. They flap and struggle against their bonds. Realization fills AuroraвЂ™s eyes. She places her hand on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Shhh. SheвЂ™s here. The wings settle down. Aurora touches the heavy iron lock She gasps as it burns her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diaval fights StefanвЂ™s men.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now an eagle. He transforms into an EAGLE. He grabs the iron net over Maleficent and pulls it away. gets to her feet. Stefan runs at her with his iron sword. She evades him and throws her robes up. White Fire erupts He falls back. His men have thrown a chain around Diavalв claws. They pull him down to stab at him.  161 162 163 164 165 166 104.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now a bear. Diaval transforms into a BEAR. It bellows and swipes at t men. They back away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora frantically looks for a way to release the wings. picks up a heavy chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stefan throws a heavy iron chain at Maleficent. It wraps around her neck. She drops to her knees as it burns her. Stefan pulls it tighter. She gasps. The men have thrown a rope around the bearвЂ™s legs, hobbling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora throws the chair at the coffin. It hits the thick glass, but does not break it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent gasps out the words.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now a... dragon. Diaval transforms into a DRAGON. It breathes fire at the men. They fend off the fire with their shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora hasnвЂ™t given up. She tilts the coffin. It falls forward and crashes onto the floor. The wings flap and struggle in the broken glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stefan pulls the chain around MaleficentвЂ™s neck tighter gasps. One of the men throws a sword at the dragon. Maleficent can barely get the words out.  167 168 105.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now a... butterfly. Diaval transforms into a butterfly. The sword flies harmlessly past him as he flutters away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora reaches out and softly touches MaleficentвЂ™s wing They stop struggling.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StefanвЂ™s men throw more heavy iron CHAINS around Malefi One wraps around her legs. Another around her waist. They pull them tightly. She crouches on the floor, chains across her body. Tortured. Stefan stands over her. He lifts his sword high over her, prepared to make the fa blow. But a brisk wind suddenly whips up from nowhere. Something large and black slams into him, knocking him of his feet. Maleficent looks up. Her face fills with astonishment to see her long-lost win flying down toward her. Aurora runs into the room from the tower stairs. Overjoyed, Maleficent lifts her arms out to her wings. Th flutter down toward her.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Be one again. ThereвЂ™s an earth-shattering... CRACK Maleficent is enveloped in a MAGICAL explosion of LIGHT A ENERGY. Then, she rises into the air on her wings. AuroraвЂ™s face lights up. The Pixies faces fall. Stefanв are just as astonished.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: Kill her! Kill her! They attack her with swords and iron chains. Maleficent fights them from the air.  169 170 106. Diaval fights at her side. Stefan motions to his men. The gradually back Maleficent toward the open door to the battlements. EXT. STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - THE BATTLEMENTS 169 Maleficent fight them. She knocks the last of the men awa ThereвЂ™s only Stefan now. She corners him against the wa with her wings.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: It would feel so good to kill you. But IвЂ™11 let you live, for AuroraвЂ™s sake.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I wonвЂ™t let you take her.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I wonвЂ™t take her. SheвЂ™1l come of her own free will. And hereвЂ™s a pittle thing you donвЂ™t know about er. She whispers in his ear. HeвЂ™s shocked by the revelation While sheвЂ™s close, he secretly brandishes his knife and tries to stab her. She backs away and lets herself fall backwards off the battlement. Stefan throws himself on top of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fall in the cup of MaleficentвЂ™s folded wings, grap as she plummets toward the earth. She tries to throw him off. But he clings to her fiercely and tries to stab her with the knife. The ground rises rapidly up toward them. They struggle. He holds onto her, raising the knife. The wind whistles past.

dialogues.speaker: STEFAN
dialogues.text: I... never... loved you! Maleficent looks into his eyes as they fall.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re a liar. She flips over suddenly. Stefan loses his grip. His face fills with terror and he falls.  171 172 107. MaleficentвЂ™s wings open at the last moment before she h the ground and she swoops into the sky. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent enters. Aurora runs into her arms. After a moment, Maleficent crouches to look into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s something I need to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: AURORA
dialogues.text: Oh Godmother, I already know. On her back, two tiny gossamer wings glitter in the light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moorland Faeries, winged and unwinged alike, have gathered on the faerie mound. Maleficent steps onto the * QueenвЂ™s Stone with her guards around her. The Stone scr in protest. She shouts. *

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: AS you see, I am not the rightful * Queen. But the time has come for me * to step down. * Maleficent steps down off the Stone. It falls silent.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Fair People of the Moors... I give you Queen Aurora. As dawn breaks, the FAIRY QUEEN AURORA floats down from above, her wings fluttering softly. She lands on the Stone. The Stone ROARS like a lion. The Faeries cheer. Musicians play and the Faeries dance. Auro sees Prince Phillip standing in the back of the crowd. Sh smiles. Maleficent stands with Diaval, the Man. Her hand finds his as they both struggle with their emotions. *  173 174 175 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pixies stop hesitantly at the faerie path. Thistlewit puts her hand out tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Are you certain?

dialogues.speaker: KNOTGRASS
dialogues.text: Yes! Queen Aurora has lifted the Binding spell.

dialogues.speaker: THISTLEWIT
dialogues.text: Come along, Flittle. WeвЂ™re going home. FlittleвЂ™s butterflies fly ahead. Flittle hears somethin She looks back. A CARRIAGE approaches on the road. The Bl Woman leans out and points at Flittle.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE WOMAN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m coming for you! Flittle gasps and runs after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The land on both sides of the Faerie path is equally gree and verdant. The FarmerвЂ™s SON, now fully grown, and his collies, her sheep. They approach the faerie path. The FarmerвЂ™s son throws down a glove. The sheep trample in their hurry to graze on the sweet moorland grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maleficent and Diaval sit in the tree, crunching black nu

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I wasnвЂ™t a very good queen, was I?

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: You did what had to be done.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Actually, I was a bad queen.  109.

dialogues.speaker: DIAVAL
dialogues.text: Very bad. In fact, in my opinion, you were the the Mistress of all Evil. She gives him an evil smile. She takes off her Horned Cro

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: I wonвЂ™t be needing this anymore. She takes it off and rubs the places on her head where th horns rested.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Ahhh. She hangs the crown on a tree limb.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Time to fly. She waves her hand at him.

dialogues.speaker: MALEFICENT
dialogues.text: Now a bird. He transforms into a RAVEN.

dialogues.speaker: AWK
dialogues.text: They lift their wings and take flight together. But before they get too far, Maleficent swings around and comes back toward the tree. She swoops low, grabs the Horned Crown and flies off agai As Maleficent and the raven soar together, wing-to-wing, above the beautiful moors fade out.
